channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Builders material etc dumped round tree, 26th October
item.description:
Builders working in immediate vicinity have dumped bags, buckets, materials etc around base of tree. Packaging shows addresses. Please investigate and prosecute. This is shameless, blatant flytipping and a real eye-sore. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince of Wales Drive, Battersea, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped caravan, 26th October
item.description:
Itâ€™s been reported by people already but still the council do nothing about it. A dumped caravan, but not only a dumped caravan there is someone living in it as well. Surly something needs to be done about that how can the be safe for people around the area that there can be some strange bloke living in a dodgy caravan.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Middle Park Avenue, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Out of date temporary parking restriction signage, 26th October
item.description:
Two large temporary parking restriction signs remain fixed to lamp standards in Parkwood Roaf nearly 3 after the work they refer to wad completed. One is at the Hurst Road end of Parkwood, the other sbout hal way up. Can they be removed?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Parkwood Road, Bexley, London

item.title: More rubbish here!, 26th October
item.description:
Rubbish is being dumped here virtually every other day. Council rubbish truck operatives see it but wonâ€™t touch it until after itâ€™s reported, which encourages other fly-tippers to add to the pile. Why isnâ€™t there an instruction for to have this spot constantly monitored and cleared on sight?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61a, Dartmouth Road, Forest Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New graffiti on front of building, 26th October
item.description:
There has been graffiti on the side of this building for some time. Now, graffiti is also being placed on the front of the building, on the light poles around the building, and even in the park retaining walls in front of the property. Can this ongoing vandalism please be addressed as soon as possible. Thanks so much. :)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet
